quote_first: At a quarter to three Carol had left home; at half-past four she had created the Georgian town; at a quarter to five she was in the dignified poverty of the Congregational parsonage, her enthusiasm pattering upon Mr.s. Leonard Warren like summer rain upon an old gray roof; at
quote_last: a town of demure courtyards and welcoming dormer windows had been erected, and at two minutes past five the entire town was as flat as Babylon.
title: Main Street
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote_first: I was told that in his vest pocket he kept a chronometer instead of a watch. If someone asked him what time it was, he would say, "
quote_time_case: A minute and twenty-one seconds to five
title: The Collected Stories
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
